Michigan Initial Health & Safety Training Module B
Section 1: Child Development

Early Intervention

  1. These services help identify developmental disabilities and provide early intervention services for children birth to 5 and their families.

  2. The services might involve speech, physical, or occupational therapy along with nurses and evaluators.

  3. Early Intervention Services are free. The family does not have to pay as long as the child qualifies for services. This will be discussed in more detail in the following slide.

  4. The services, support and resources are available statewide and nationally.
